from dataclasses import dataclass
from typing import Dict, Any, Tuple
import numpy as np
from sklearn.feature_extraction.text import TfidfVectorizer
from sklearn.model_selection import train_test_split
from sklearn.linear_model import LogisticRegression
from sklearn.naive_bayes import MultinomialNB
from sklearn.semi_supervised import SelfTrainingClassifier
from sklearn.cluster import KMeans
from sklearn.metrics import accuracy_score, precision_recall_fscore_support, confusion_matrix



[docs]
@dataclass
class Split:
    X_train: Any
    X_test: Any
    y_train: np.ndarray
    y_test: np.ndarray
    vectorizer: TfidfVectorizer





[docs]
def vectorize_text(texts, cfg) -> TfidfVectorizer:
    pp = cfg["preprocess"]
    vec = TfidfVectorizer(
        min_df=pp.get("min_df", 2),
        max_df=pp.get("max_df", 0.95),
        ngram_range=tuple(pp.get("ngram_range", [1,1])),
    )
    vec.fit(texts)
    return vec





[docs]
def split_and_vectorize(df, text_col, label_col, cfg) -> Split:
    vec = vectorize_text(df[text_col], cfg)
    X = vec.transform(df[text_col])
    y = df[label_col].values.astype(int)
    X_train, X_test, y_train, y_test = train_test_split(
        X, y,
        test_size=cfg["dataset"].get("test_size", 0.2),
        random_state=cfg["dataset"].get("random_state", 42),
        stratify=y
    )
    return Split(X_train, X_test, y_train, y_test, vec)





[docs]
def train_supervised(split: Split, cfg) -> Dict[str, Dict]:
    results = {}
    class_weight = "balanced" if cfg["training"].get("use_class_weight", True) else None

    if "logreg" in cfg["training"].get("supervised_models", ["logreg","nb"]):
        lr = LogisticRegression(max_iter=200, class_weight=class_weight, n_jobs=None)
        lr.fit(split.X_train, split.y_train)
        y_pred = lr.predict(split.X_test)
        acc = accuracy_score(split.y_test, y_pred)
        p, r, f1, _ = precision_recall_fscore_support(split.y_test, y_pred, average="binary")
        results["logreg"] = {"model": lr, "acc": acc, "p": p, "r": r, "f1": f1}

    if "nb" in cfg["training"].get("supervised_models", ["logreg","nb"]):
        nb = MultinomialNB()
        nb.fit(split.X_train, split.y_train)
        y_pred = nb.predict(split.X_test)
        acc = accuracy_score(split.y_test, y_pred)
        p, r, f1, _ = precision_recall_fscore_support(split.y_test, y_pred, average="binary")
        results["nb"] = {"model": nb, "acc": acc, "p": p, "r": r, "f1": f1}

    return results





[docs]
def train_semi_supervised(split: Split, cfg) -> Dict[str, Dict]:
    frac = cfg["semi_supervised"].get("unlabeled_fraction", 0.6)
    y_semi = split.y_train.copy()
    n_unl = int(len(y_semi) * frac)
    rng = np.random.default_rng(cfg["dataset"].get("random_state", 42))
    mask_idx = rng.choice(len(y_semi), size=n_unl, replace=False)
    y_semi[mask_idx] = -1  # -1 marks unlabeled

    base = LogisticRegression(max_iter=200, class_weight="balanced")
    self_train = SelfTrainingClassifier(base_estimator=base, threshold=0.7, verbose=False)
    self_train.fit(split.X_train, y_semi)
    y_pred = self_train.predict(split.X_test)
    acc = accuracy_score(split.y_test, y_pred)
    p, r, f1, _ = precision_recall_fscore_support(split.y_test, y_pred, average="binary")
    return {"self_training": {"model": self_train, "acc": acc, "p": p, "r": r, "f1": f1}}





[docs]
def train_unsupervised(split: Split, cfg) -> Dict[str, Dict]:
    # Fit KMeans to training TF-IDF, then map clusters to labels by majority.
    km = KMeans(n_clusters=2, n_init=10, random_state=cfg["dataset"].get("random_state", 42))
    km.fit(split.X_train)
    # Map cluster -> label by majority in train
    train_clusters = km.predict(split.X_train)
    cluster_to_label = {}
    for c in [0,1]:
        mask = (train_clusters == c)
        if mask.sum() == 0:
            cluster_to_label[c] = 0
        else:
            majority = int(np.round(split.y_train[mask].mean()))
            cluster_to_label[c] = majority
    # Predict on test
    test_clusters = km.predict(split.X_test)
    y_pred = np.array([cluster_to_label[c] for c in test_clusters])
    acc = accuracy_score(split.y_test, y_pred)
    p, r, f1, _ = precision_recall_fscore_support(split.y_test, y_pred, average="binary")
    return {"kmeans": {"model": km, "acc": acc, "p": p, "r": r, "f1": f1}}
